characters: A SERIES OF IMAGES, THE ORIGIN OF "THE GRUDGE", FLASH BY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FADE IN on MARIA (late 20s), asleep in bed. She's breathtakingly beautiful. Morning light fills the room. sound of wind, and rippling cloth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria stirs, and opens her eyes.     She stretches conten

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she frowns.    Rolls over.    She's alone in the bed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she's not: PETER (20s) sits on the edge, his back to Two fresh, steaming mugs of coffee sit on a tray near him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.     Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter doesn't turn. He slowly stands and walks forward towards an OPEN WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something strange about the way he moves -- stiff almost jerkily, straining his joints and muscles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria gets out of bed, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter?    What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses at the window.    Turns his head to look back a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes are vacant.    His face is a blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Peter slowly leans forward.     And falls from the w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria stands in shock as the sound of SCREECHING TIRES fr outside reaches her ears. Then SCREAMS OF TERROR from bel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aghast, she finally manages to numbly walk forward, towar the window. We MOVE PAST her and TILT DOWN TO REVEAL --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- PETER'S BODY lies in the middle of the street.     His has burst open, his body broken and twisted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE PAVEMENT: a line of blood appears, moving down the center of the screen. As if hitting grooves we cannot see

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the blood slowly forms the shape of two KANJI CHARACTE A translation appears over them: "The Grudge."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blur of movement as hundreds of people stream up from a subway tunnel. Most are Japanese. We're not in Kansas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing in the middle of the rush-hour pedestrian traffi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN (20s, American). She faces upstream, looking for someone. The flow threatens to carry her away in a heartbeat. She looks fragile, intimidated by the madness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to see her boyfriend DOUG (20s, American) approaching. With a reassuring smile he takes her hand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and together, they force their way through the throng, trying to escape the flow. They're jostled and crushed by the crowd, and Doug protectively pulls Karen closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never get used to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should find a different train station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He abruptly stops, right in the middle of traffic, still holding Karen's hand. She turns, wondering what's going o She sees the smile on his lips a moment before --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- he sweeps Karen into his arms and kisses her. As if th crowd of businessmen surging around them isn't there at a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's tender and loving, and she responds... at first.   B then she pulls away, shy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A public display of affection is considered rude in Japan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an opening ahead into a SIDE STREET.   Doug and K deftly slip out of the traffic --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2b   EXT. TOKYO STREET - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and walk hand-in-hand down the much quieter street, aw from the crowded thoroughfare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug smiles as they pass by two JAPANESE HIGH SCHOOL COUP making out on the street corner. He turns to give Karen a sarcastic look --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04      2A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but she didn't notice the school kids. She's looking i the other direction, at a trickle of SMOKE wafting up ove nearby fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug follows as she walks toward an OLD TEMPLE, nestled beneath a skyscraper. A collision of the ancient and mode The fence surrounds a GRAVEYARD adjacent to the temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We walk past this temple every day, Karen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I've never seen this before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A JAPANESE MAN stands before an ornate headstone, lightin bundle of incense and bowing before the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a Buddhist ritual. The incense smoke carries the prayers to the spirits of his ancestors, to help them remain at peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLINK. She turns as Doug, grinning, lights a cigarette wi his Zippo, flicking it shut and pocketing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's amazing. You're like this infinite storehouse of wisdom. Or trivia. I'm not sure which.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not trivia. It's what they believe. And it's far better, by the way, than your little pollution ritual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug's grin softens to a smile. He doesn't respond... but the way he's looking at Karen makes her curious:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns away for a moment, almost shyly, dropping his cigarette and crushing it. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04      2B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I just -- I like that about you. You seem to be able to remember everything that's really important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles.   A tender moment.   Then... he checks his wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen checks her own watch, realizing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, crap --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs his hand and starts to walk quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, you're gonna be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04      3-4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2c    EXT. CAMPUS - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An international college in Tokyo. The autumn chill doesn deter the students from enjoying the beautiful day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen and Doug, still holding hands, enter the campus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2cc   EXT. NURSING CARE CENTER - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen and Doug approach the doors of a NURSING CARE CENTE She pulls him to the side just as he's stepping under a WORKMAN'S LADDER by the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN Uh-uh. Seven years of bad luck. (before Doug can respond:) And I might have a vested interest in those years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUG Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug smiles, kissing her romantically.   Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUG Will I see you tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN I'll call you when I get home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a flourish, Doug SWINGS HIMSELF back under the ladde

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUG Fourteen.    I hate odd numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the front doors, we see Doug kiss Karen again. finally separate, and Doug walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     4A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Karen walks through the doors into a bright, atrium- lobby area. She waves "hello" to the RECEPTIONIST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaning against a desk behind Reception is Karen's boss A (40s, American). He's got a phone to his ear -- it's ringing. An ANSWERING MACHINE picks up in Japanese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex mutters and hangs up.   Then he notices --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's started up a STAIRCASE in the center of the lobby. turns and comes back down, walking over to Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you free this afternoon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just came by to pick up some books I left here. I'm not scheduled to work today --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But are you free?    Do you have class?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head:) Just a test to study for.   Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex smiles, holding out a file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04    6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wish has been granted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen takes the file and opens it, looking at the first p - a picture of an OLDER WOMAN (EMMA) is attached.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Yoko's case, but she didn't show up for work this morning, and I can't reach her at home. She must be sick, or something. And she has the damn house key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Studying the file, Karen squints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this phrase?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Mild dementia with severe lethargy." Apparently she sleeps through most of the day. Her daughter-in-law doesn't work, so she'll probably be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen seems unsure.   It's a big step for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one who's been bugging me about getting out there on your own. Besides, it's an English-only house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of Alex's CO-WORKERS appears in the doorway, motionin him. Alex quickly hands Karen a card:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the address. Use the wall chart if you need help -- and don't forget to bring a map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen looks at THE ADDRESS -- a string of thirty numbers Japanese characters. She glances up at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WALL CHART: a color-coded diagram shows how the long address string is broken down into Postal Code, Prefectur City, Ward, District, Block, Sub-Block and House Number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX Don't worry Karen, you're ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen nods.   But she's not quite as confident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4a    INT. RAIL STATION - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People rush madly around Karen as she studies A LARGE MAP the wall. It's the Tokyo rail system -- daunting, at best

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4bb   INT. TRAIN - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen sits uncomfortably on the crowded transit car, sque in tightly by the people around her. The LOUD CRYING of a baby adds to her discomfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The transit car pulls to a stop and a handful of people g out. Karen is one of them, shouldering her backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen walks down the populated sidewalk, weaving through STREET VENDORS, and passing a large GROCERY STORE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pauses, looking at the address on her card. She approaches a WOMAN and her DAUGHTER (6) and speaks to the Japanese. The woman nods, pointing towards a small ALLEY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen gives the daughter a smile;   the girl hides behind mother's leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04      7A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen exits the alley, entering a quiet, narrow street. She's still not sure if she's in the right place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then her eyes fix on something. She begins to walk towards it, her gaze never leaving it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 6a   EXT. THE HOUSE - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- it's THE HOUSE.   Cozy and shaded, nestled into the de end of the street.   Large by Tokyo standards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She double-checks the address and opens the gate, walking around a BICYCLE leaning against the wall and following t stepping-stone path to the front door. She knocks. No answer. She tries again. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, an afterthought, she tries the handle.   It's unloc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen pokes her head inside the genkan (entry hall).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN Hello?   Mrs. Williams?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. She tentatively steps inside, and the door close behind her. It's dark and musty -- the blinds are drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is anyone here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and LOCKS THE FRONT DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen stands in the doorway, surveying the room.   The pl is in a complete state of disarray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SCRAPING sound grabs Karen's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HER POV: at the far end of the room, a FROSTED-GLASS PANE DOOR leads to an adjacent room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HAND is visible on the other side, clawing at the glass

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen runs over and slides open the door, revealing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 8a   INT. TATAMI ROOM - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMMA (60s, American). The older woman in the picture from Karen's file. She's lying on her stomach on a stained mattress, feebly looking up at Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God... are you alright? --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen immediately kneels down next to the infirm woman, helping her sit up. Emma looks dazed and disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen's eyes sweep the room.   It reeks of neglect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma sits on the back porch, staring vacantly. But her expression isn't simply blank - there's an odd sadness th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     8A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen is washing the dirty sheets in a bucket and hanging them to dry. She finishes, turning to her charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04       9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Emma. Let's try again: my name is Karen. Do you remember? I'm from the Health Center. I'm substituting for Yoko, just for today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma doesn't respond -- and there's no indication that sh remembers Karen introducing herself before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kneeling in front of Emma, Karen notices a BAND-AID aroun one of her fingers. Blood has soaked through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you need a new Band-Aid. How'd this happen, Emma? (still no reaction) Would you like a bath? Maybe that will help you feel better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma doesn't even turn towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen turns on the water, puts the stopper over the drain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen supports Emma's weight as she leads the old woman slowly down the hallway to the bathroom entrance --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Emma stops at the doorway.    Eyes fixed on THE TUB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Emma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes Emma's hand and walks inside. But Emma doesn't budge. Her free hand TIGHTLY CLUTCHES the door frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes are wide.   Staring at the bathtub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen uses a sponge to bathe Emma, her robe rolled to her waist. Emma stares absently at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     9A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Emma back in bed, Karen steps out of the back room a slides the door shut. Leans against it for a moment. A tough first day on the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04        10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen has straightened up the room, and is vacuuming the floor. Something under the couch catches in the vacuum intake, jamming it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns off the vacuum and feels underneath, pulling ou CRUMPLED PHOTO -- ripped into pieces, compressed in a bal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen sits at the kitchen table, flattening and taping together the pieces of the photograph. She finishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE PHOTO: a grinning JAPANESE BOY holds a cute BLACK CAT. His MOTHER and FATHER stand beside him. They're all beaming at the camera -- a perfect, happy family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's a piece missing.   The MOTHER'S FACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen walks back into the Living Room. She looks undernea the couch for the missing piece. Can't see anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lays down and sticks her arm under the couch, feeling around. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen sticks her arm in deeper, to the shoulder, strainin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She suddenly jerks her arm back, wincing.   She has a sma cut on her finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen looks under the couch for what cut her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a small FURNITURE NAIL sticks out underneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice one, Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets to her feet, folding up the incomplete picture a stuffing it into her pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen steps into the foyer with the vacuum cleaner. She looks up at A RAILING overhead. Some trash is visible sticking over the edge. Karen shakes her head:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04       11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gathers up the vacuum and heads up to the SECOND FLOO HALLWAY. There's a nearby door, closed (the FRONT ROOM), an open door at the end (the REAR ROOM).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she looks for an outlet, she hears a SCRATCHING SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen stands there for a moment, listening.    Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she walks towards the open door at the end of the ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen steps inside. MOVING BOXES are stacked against the wall, next to a desk. It's an unfinished room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She listens.   No scratching.   Nothing unusual here.   E

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen notices a lone object sitting on an otherwise empty shelf. It's a BLACK CERAMIC CAT. Facing the wall. Strange

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then Karen hears the SCRATCHING SOUND again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen steps into the hallway and listens.   There it is a and this time there's no doubt --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sounds are coming from the room by the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen walks to the door. She pauses, disturbed by the eer sounds from inside. Then she reaches for the doorknob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUD. THUD. Karen hesitates. The strange rhythmic THUDDIN continues, coming from beyond the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous:) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen takes a breath.   And turns the doorknob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sounds immediately stop as Karen enters the MASTER BEDROOM. It's dark, thick blinds covering the windows. A frosted window, overlooking the foyer, isn't helping much

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands there for a moment, listening.   Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCRATCH SCRATCH. Startled, she gasps and turns towards TH CLOSED CLOSET DOORS. That's where the sound is coming fro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then she notices something strange about the closet d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been sealed shut with duct tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SCRATCHING quickens, as if sensing a presence nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then there's a muffled MEOW.   There's a cat in there

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen pulls off the duct tape. She reaches for the door handle, slowly sliding it open a crack and peering inside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The closet seems empty, except for a large BOOK on a shel Karen reaches inside and picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she sees, in the darkened far corner of the closet, SMALL BLACK CAT. It's sitting on something, watching her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen slides the door the rest of the way open --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- revealing A YOUNG JAPANESE BOY (age 7) sitting in the corner, staring at Karen. The cat is curled up on his lap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Startled, Karen drops the book and falls backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen is on her cell phone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he was shut in a closet! There was tape around the -- No, they're not home yet. I don't know, Emma hasn't said a word to me -- He's still upstairs -- yes, I'm sure he's Japanese -- But -- Yes, alright, Alex. Just please get here as soon as you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen hangs up, putting the phone down on the kitchen tab She leans against the counter, exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then her attention turns to THE BOOK she found in the clo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen can't resist.   She opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOOK is a large journal, filled with elegant Japanese writing. Karen flips through it, stopping on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04        13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PHOTOGRAPH.   A handsome young man, smiling at the came

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We recognize him.   It's PETER, from the opening scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen walks to the front door, reaching out to unlock it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but she pauses, realizing something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches into her pocket, pulling out THE PHOTO she fo It only takes a second to verify --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- THE BOY in the photo is the one she found in the close

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen lowers the photo, bewildered.    Then she looks up, startled by --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOY. He's kneeling on the second floor landing above, watching her through the bars of the metal railing. Creep

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen takes a step forward, forcing a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy just stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Karen. What's yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOY Toshio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before she can respond --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RING! RING!   The phone in the next room startles her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen enters the room as the ANSWERING MACHINE picks up, voices of a happy couple on the GREETING (in English):

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW & JENNIFER (ON MACHINE) "Konnichiwa! Matt and Jennifer aren't around, leave a message."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Hey, guys, it's Susan. Matt, are you there? Pick up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04       14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSAN (ON MACHINE) (cont'd) Okay, well, I'm leaving work now so you can try my cell, or just call me at home later."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The caller pauses. Karen steps closer to the phone base, curious, listening:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSAN (ON MACHINE) "I just wanted to make sure Mom is okay. Yesterday was... a bit weird, and -- I'm just a little worried."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen, reluctant but realizing she should pick up, reache for the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but the PHONE BASE is empty.   The cordless is missing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Karen tries to figure out how to answer with the base:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSAN (ON MACHINE) "Listen, just give me a call when you can, okay?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK.   Too late -- the caller hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence returns to the room... but not completely.     Ka hears the soft sound of WHISPERING from nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beyond her, we see a PALE FACE (KAYAKO) pressed against t frosted window of the sliding door of the TATAMI ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The face pulls away from the glass just before Karen turn towards it. But the sound of WHISPERING continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she slowly walks to the door, we can make out some wor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMMA (O.S.) ...I've told them over and over... I've told them over and over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen listens for a moment, then slides the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very dark in the room -- the lights have been turned off. Emma, sitting up in bed, turns towards Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN Emma, who were you talking to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04        15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when Karen notices THE INDENTATION in the mattress across from where Emma is sitting. Where someone else wou be, if the old woman was having a conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma looks up at Karen with pleading eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want her to leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen sits down next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should get some rest, Emma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She helps Emma lie back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but as the old woman's eyes move to the ceiling, they suddenly grow wide, her mouth opening in fear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Karen follows her gaze, looking up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and she SCREAMS, falling off the mattress, backing awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MURKY BLACKNESS is lowering from the ceiling. Formless first, but flowing and shifting... like a FIGURE draped w black silk. Drifting down until the shadowy "head" is onl inches from Emma's terrified face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then the "head" slowly turns, rotating towards Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the midst of the blackness are TWO DISEMBODIED EYES. Filled with an intense rage. Focused directly on Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Karen's NERVE-SHATTERING SCREAM, we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW and his wife JENNIFER are in bed. He sleeps sound she doesn't. She's staring at the ceiling, listening to -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- SOUNDS coming in through the open bedroom door. Someon moving downstairs, fumbling around, bumping into things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer, frustrated, lets out a sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew comes downstairs, dressed in a business suit. pauses to pick up some of the RUBBISH on the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer watches the last drops of coffee fall into the p She pours herself a mug, takes a big sip. Looks exhausted

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew enters, surprised to see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW You're up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JENNIFER Mmmmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew glances into the back room through another slidin door -- the windows on this one are clear, not frosted li the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIS POV:   Emma is asleep on her mattress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW I wonder if Mom's okay. She's been sleeping ever since we got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JENNIFER Not at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew turns to her, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JENNIFER I told you, Matthew, you can sleep through anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew comes over, kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW I'm sorry, sweetheart. It was probably just the move -- I'm sure she'll get back on schedule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer nods, not convinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW You seen my travel mug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JENNIFER I didn't unpack it yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew kneels down next to a pair of MOVING BOXES in the corner -- `KITCHEN' written on the side. He explores it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04   17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should say something to the helper, what's her name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows? Maybe there's something she can suggest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.     Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds his travel mug, wrapped in the sports section of American newspaper. Matthew scans it as he fills his mug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss seeing this every morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response from his wife. He turns to see Jennifer looki down at Emma through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew walks over, puts an arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, kiddo. You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went for a walk yesterday. Just to explore. I got lost and couldn't find anyone who could speak English, who could help me. I felt so... stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This will get easier soon, for Mom, for all of us. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or else I'll tell the company it's just not working out, and that we're going back to the States with or without my old job. They can get someone else to crunch their numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This makes Jennifer feel better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But until then -- promise me you'll give it a good try, okay Jen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JENNIFER Deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Matthew walks outside, stopping to loo a familiar BICYCLE, leaning against the house near the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this Yoko's bike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been here all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew rolls the bike from the porch to the gate, leanin against the wall (where we saw it earlier).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to Jennifer, giving her a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll probably be home late, maybe around nine or so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer gives him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you'd forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew pauses, looks back blankly.    Jennifer just smil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner, your sister?    At seven?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW Oh yeah.   Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were going to cook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a big conference.    They usually run long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do the shopping. Just call me if you're going to be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes back inside, closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer stands by a cart, looking pale under the stark fluorescent lighting. She also looks shell-shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HER POV: before her is a WALL OF JAPANESE PRODUCTS. Barel a lick of English on any of the brightly-colored packages

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer is, in a word, clueless. She looks around for assistance -- but she's lost in a whirl of Japanese faces

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tentatively reaches towards a bowl-shaped package. Studies the Japanese writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stealing a glance around her, she quietly tears open a co of the bowl. Peeks inside. Sniffs it. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the same package, a microwaveable soup bowl, now open with a spoon sticking out of it. Resting, with a gla of water, atop the kotatsu table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN TO REVEAL a pair of feet on the lip of a MOVING BOX n to the table. It's Jennifer, asleep on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLATTERING sound wakes her, followed by the sound of FOOTSTEPS running away. We PULL BACK as Jennifer sees her bowl, and the glass next to it, have been knocked over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits up, looking into the TATAMI ROOM. Emma sits on t edge of her mattress, staring blankly at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer gets up, sternly walks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you need something, all you have to do is say so --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops short as she sees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOOTPRINTS. Formed from the broth, and noodles, of her spilled soup. They're the footprints of a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they lead away from the back room, down the main hall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04      20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer looks back up to see Emma watching her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer follows the DAMP FOOTPRINTS. They're getting lighter, and cease altogether in the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands there for a moment, bewildered. Then she tense as if sensing she's being watched. She slowly turns to se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- A BLACK CAT. Sitting on the first landing of the stair Staring at her with bright yellow eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jennifer takes a step towards it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO CHILD'S HANDS reach around the corner, and pick up th cat, pulling it out of view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JENNIFER Who's -- who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. She walks up the stairs and looks around the corner. Nothing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a deep breath, and starts to climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaching the top, Jennifer catches a glimpse of a familia BOY running into the FRONT ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slowly walks towards the open door -- we can't see in the room from the hallway. But she pauses as she hears --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUD.   THUD.   The same rhythmic thumping that Karen hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, Jennifer steps inside the room, disappear from our sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear her suddenly draw a GASP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. As we DRIFT CLOSER to the doorway, we notice something strange: the room appears to be growing darker. A SHARP BREATHING can be heard from inside... quick, pani gulps of air. Growing faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as we reach the doorway, the harsh breathing stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04   20A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of stillness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the door is SLAMMED SHUT from the inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew enters from work, jacket slung over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW (calling out) Sorry I'm late, it took awhile to wrap things up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves his briefcase by the door and turns to the hall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- noticing the house is completely DARK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW Jen?   Susan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew turns on the lights. The room has reverted to its messy state, even worse than before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down at A PICTURE, formerly hanging on the wall, lying on the ground. The glass is broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW What the hell? --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He quickly goes to the BACK ROOM. Emma sits on the edge o her bed, dazed and staring. In the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW Mom?   Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.    He kneels down next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW Where's Jennifer, Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still nothing.      He surveys the mess in the room.   An

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW Did Yoko come today, Mom? Remember? The pretty girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets to his feet, looking at the SPILLED SOUP in the living room, now hardened and crusty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVER THE RAILING:     Matthew re-enters the foyer, lookin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW Jen?   Are you up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He climbs up the stairs, walking to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew stands in the doorway of the dark room.   He trie light switch. Nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW Dammit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slowly enters, feeling his way through the room. We ca barely make him out in the darkness... we see the shape o THE BED by a window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew feels his way to a table next to the bed.   Switc on a small lamp --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- JENNIFER IS RIGHT NEXT TO HIM. Lying in bed, staring w eyed at the ceiling. Matthew, startled, falls backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW Jennifer?    What is it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew rushes to her, shaking her. She's unresponsive. T only sign she's alive is that HER FEARFUL EYES slowly fix him. Her mouth opens, as if she's trying to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? What happened???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries harder to form words, but can only produce a CR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll... I'll call an ambulance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew runs into the kitchen grabbing A LARGE BOOK on on the moving boxes. The Japanese equivalent of a YELLOW PAG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He whips it open -- hardly a word of English in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stack of BOOKS sit on the very top of a tall bookshelf. Scissors and a roll of DUCT TAPE rest atop them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew pushes everything aside to get at a JAPANESE/ENGL DICTIONARY underneath. The DUCT TAPE falls to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tears across the room to THE PHONE BASE -- but the cordless phone is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew re-enters, out of breath. He sits next to Jennife who hasn't moved. Puts a hand on her chest to make sure she's still breathing. She is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks through the dictionary, finding the word he need

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Ambulance'... "kyukyusha".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he quickly rips open the Yellow Pages --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- seeing, in plain English, `EMERGENCY' on the first pag Below that: `FIRE/AMBULANCE -- DIAL 119'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops the book and reaches across the bed for a phone, a table at the far side --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- THE BOY (TOSHIO) stands up, between Matthew and the ph

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he looks different from before: his skin is discolore his lips and eyes are ringed and sullen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? What -- what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toshio makes a STRANGE SOUND. Looks at Jennifer, then tur to Matthew, SNARLING at him like a CAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew, shocked, falls backwards off the bed, hitting th table with the lamp. It drops to the ground --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and TOSHIO'S SHADOW, cast by the fallen light, begins STRETCH AND GROW across the ceiling. The shadow creeps ov Jennifer, shifting and coming towards Matthew --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Matthew grabs the lamp.    He reaches it, holding it u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first, it looks like both Jennifer and Toshio have disappeared. But then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Jennifer, suddenly back on the bed, SITS UPRIGHT, jerk as if she's been yanked up and forward. Her mouth is wide and gasping --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and then she falls back onto the bed.     Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew, stunned, backs away from the bed, against the closet. Terrified, he doesn't notice --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the THUD THUD sound growing around him.     Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- TOSHIO'S HEAD comes into frame behind him. Matthew hea a GROWLING SOUND and turns, seeing Toshio right there! --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOORBELL rings.   Then a few more times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSAN (American, late 20s) enters, with two bottles of wi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSAN Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kicks off her shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys in the kitchen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan walks in, puts the wine on the table.     Looks aro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out:) I thought you guys were gonna cook!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes into the BACK ROOM.    Sits next to Emma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSAN Hi, Mom.    How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma turns to her with her usual vacant look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04      24A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a CREAK from above.   Susan looks up at the ceili

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04       25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I came at a bad time, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twisting a corkscrew into a wine bottle, Susan leans into foyer, yelling upstairs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you guys one minute to finish whatever you're doing up there and get your butts down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she heads back towards the kitchen, we CRANE UP to see

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW. He's walking down the second floor hall. He look different: the expression on his face is troubled, occupi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's dragging his dead wife's body.   By the hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls her inside the REAR ROOM -- the doorway looks mo imposing, more ominous, than before. It's dark and malevolent, the threshold to a secret that won't stay bur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We CRANE BACK DOWN to see Susan in the kitchen.   She's p a glass of wine and sighs impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks back down the hall into the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean it, guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence from upstairs.   Shaking her head:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I warned you. Prepare to be emotionally scarred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts up the stairs and turns the first corner --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- MATTHEW is sitting there, hands on his knees, looking harried. Susan YELPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSAN Matthew!   Don't scare me like that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's shaking slightly.   His eyes drift up to hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?   Where's Jennifer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04      26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She went out. Something came up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope she's not long.    I'm absolutely starving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew looks back down at his feet.      Susan misreads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it. You guys forgot to go shopping, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew abruptly stands.    Looming over his sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.     This is a bad time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves forward, right into her. His momentum pushes Sus back into the foyer. She holds onto his shirt:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did something happen?    What's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew's hands suddenly TIGHTEN ON HER SHOULDERS. His ey grow wide, filled with anger, as he whispers fiercely --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't love me... she never loved me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan watches as he repeats himself, over and over. scared, she finally SHAKES HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew slowly looks up.    Malice on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps forward.   Susan backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, Matthew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04        27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew, please --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan fumbles with the front door. She gets it open and r out just before Matthew reaches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON MATTHEW: he stands there, head tilted down, for a mome Then he straightens. Slowly closes the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew heads back upstairs. He reaches the second floor opens the door to the rear bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room beyond is dark. But A DARK FIGURE is visible, standing in the far corner, facing Matthew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps inside, and the door slowly swings shut behind h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an overcast afternoon.  Swollen clouds hang low over The House. It looks a bit more imposing than usual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MAILBOX is adorned with the Japanese equivalent of a Sale" sign -- weather-worn, and looks like it's been ther for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUZUKI (30s, Japanese), a Real Estate agent, waits by the gate. Then he notices something. Waves, and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's SUSAN, approaching with MATTHEW, JENNIFER and EMMA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan shakes Suzuki's hand and they exchange a greeting i Japanese. She turns to her brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Suzuki-san, he's the Real Estate broker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzuki bows at Matthew and Jennifer, says something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said: "welcome to Tokyo". And that you must be very important to your company for them to rent this place for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04        28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew grins.   Susan rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone enters, checking the place out. Suzuki and Susan slip off their shoes. As Matthew steps into the foyer:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW Oh.    Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kneels down, untying his shoes.   Jennifer looks perpl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even in our own house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even in your own house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzuki smiles as Matthew and Jennifer take off their shoe Susan says something to him in Japanese and he laughs. Th walk down the hall, and Matthew and Jennifer follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzuki opens the blinds, letting some light into the plac It's not helping much -- it's still pretty dreary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't the layout great? Wait `till you see the back room. It's perfect for Mom -- she won't have to deal with the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer follows him through the room.   She doesn't look quite as enthusiastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew slides open the door leading to the TATAMI ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her bed won't be here until next week, but we can put the mattress on the floor. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer warms a bit.   The wooden room is beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan asks Suzuki a question in Japanese, and he responds

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04    29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSAN He says no one has lived in this house for three years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JENNIFER Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan asks Suzuki in Japanese.    He shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUZUKI (trying his English:) Ex-pen-sive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew suddenly realizes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW Where's Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We slowly CRANE UP to the SECOND FLOOR HALL, moving towar the REAR ROOM at the end. The door is ajar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan comes up the stairs, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSAN Mom?   Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 44b   INT. THE HOUSE - FRONT ROOM - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan looks inside -- Emma isn't there. She's about to le when something catches her attention. She walks to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CLOSET. The door is open. Susan kneels down, looking something inside it. She picks it up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- it's the CERAMIC CAT Karen found earlier. As Susan examines it, she notices something on the wall of the clo (which we don't see). Her face softens, and she smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW (O.S.) Did you get her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSAN (under her breath:) Take a pill, will ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan stands and walks out of the room. But we stay in th closet, PANNING TO REVEAL the closet wall. It's covered w BLACK CRAYON, low to the ground, the work of a child. The images are dozens of BLACK CATS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04      29A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma stands in the dead center of the empty bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking directly up at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan enters, placing the ceramic cat on THE SHELF where Karen found it earlier. Except Susan faces it INTO THE RO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Mom. You know what the doctor said about stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes Emma's hand, but the old woman doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew and Jennifer enter, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW She okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSAN Mom?   What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone follows her gaze to the ceiling.   Only Emma has unmistakable look of dread on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzuki walks from the kitchen into the hallway, giving th place one final look-over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses by the open bathroom door.   Looks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04       30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzuki enters, looking at THE TUB:    filled to the brim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, Suzuki kneels down next to the bathtub. pulls the thin CHAIN connected to the rubber stopper --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but the end of the chain comes out of the water. It's not connected after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzuki eyes the plug at the bottom of the tub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he takes off his jacket.   Rolls up his shirt sleeve

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And reaches into the water for the rubber stopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just out of reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rolls up his sleeve a little more.   Reaches deeper --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- suddenly there's a BURST OF SOUND: a dull THUMPING, something THRASHING in water, the SCREAMING of a YOUNG BO voice MUFFLED by water --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Suzuki recoils as water SPLASHES UP around him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- he falls away from the tub in horror, landing on his b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BATHTUB: Filled to the brim.     Still and silent. much as a ripple on the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That couldn't have just been his imagination, could it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he slowly stands, he sees something out of the corner his eye --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a DEAD CAT, bloody and torn, in the corner of the room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04         30A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Suzuki backs away from it, eyes widening in horror, he startled by --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW, standing in the doorway.   Beaming at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW It's perfect. We'll take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzuki looks back to the corner.    There's no dead cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RINGING SOUND comes into focus -- the BEEPING of a phon waiting for someone to pick up and make the connection...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 47a   OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 47b   OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 47c   OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's after-hours in this office space: CUBICLES fill the center, surrounded by glass-windowed OFFICES. The glitter lights of the Tokyo cityscape beyond show a hell of a vie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One light still burns in an office towards the end --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- SUSAN'S OFFICE. She's working late. She wears a phone headset while she types lines of code into her computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's answering.   A familiar answering machine picks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW & JENNIFER (ON MACHINE) "Konnichiwa! Matt and Jennifer aren't around, leave a message."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSAN (INTO PHONE) Hey, guys, it's Susan. Matt, are you there? Pick up... Okay, well, I'm leaving work now so you can try my cell, or just call me at home later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pauses.   Leans back, away from the keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSAN (INTO PHONE) I just wanted to make sure Mom is okay. Yesterday was... (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04        32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSAN (INTO PHONE) (cont'd) a bit weird, and -- I'm just a little worried. Listen, just give me a call when you can, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up, taking the headset off.   Concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan walks through the hallway. She hears a strange scraping sound -- it sounds as though something is being dragged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan turns around, but the hallway looks normal. Is it j her imagination?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound starts again, coming closer. Susan gets scared opens the door to the emergency stairwell beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hallway is chilly -- Susan shivers. She's about to st walking down when she looks up, noticing THE LIGHTS at th top floor FLICKERING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wind suddenly blows through the center of the stairwell with an eerie ROAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan looks disconcerted as she starts walking down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we hear the SCRAPING SOUND again. Startled, Susan pauses and looks down, over the railing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing there -- but the sound continues, growing louder, like something is moving up towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSAN (calling out:) Is anybody there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, the lights on the top floor finally GO OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan's breath catches in her throat as she looks up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights on the next floor go out. And the next. The darkness above growing closer with each darkening floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan nervously looks back down -- the SCRAPING is even closer. And then, for an instant, she sees A SKINNY PALE HAND on the railing two floors down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrified, Susan starts to back up -- but stops as she realizes that the darkness from above is almost upon her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     32A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Susan sees A FINGERTIP of the hand at the corner of floor where she stands, and A HEAD COVERED WITH BLACK HAI slowly crawling up on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan's mouth opens in a silent screen. With nowhere to escape, she opens the same door and rushes back into the hallway --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 49b   OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04        33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 49c    OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 49cc   INT. OFFICE BUILDING - 10TH FLOOR HALL - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but her lucky RABBIT'S FOOT gets caught on the door la Panicking, Susan struggles to free herself --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the crack, she sees the darkness continuing to co down. The lights on Susan's floor FLICKER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan looks up to see A PALE BOY on the landing to the hi floor. The SAME BOY is also standing on the landing of ea floor above. They're all staring down at Susan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan screams as she desperately tries to yank her chain free... and then she sees THE PALE HAND clutching her rabbit's foot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door shuts, and Susan falls backwards into the hallwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She jumps to her feet and runs down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 52a    OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cramped room. Susan stands in the doorway, animatedly talking to a young SECURITY GUARD sitting at a desk lined with VIDEO MONITORS. She's speaking rapidly, and shaking:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSAN (IN JAPANESE) In the stairs... there was... something... a strange person... all the lights were going out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard doesn't understand her -- in her panic, Susan's MISPRONOUNCING HER WORDS, and she knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan takes a breath, frustrated and frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSAN (pleading, in English) Please. Help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard stands, placing a reassuring hand on her should

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUARD (IN JAPANESE) I'll take a look. Wait here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard leaves.   Susan doesn't look thrilled to be alo

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: 54aa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 54ab   INT. 10TH FLOOR HALL - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding a flashlight, the Guard walks down the hallway, checking the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04       35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 54b   INT. OFFICE BUILDING - SECURITY ROOM - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan takes a breath and sits down, trying to relax. It's obvious that she feels safer, here in the Security Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she notices movement on one of the SECURITY MONITORS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE SCREEN: -- the GUARD continues down the 10TH FLOOR HALL, stopping at the door to the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan leans toward the monitor for a better view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE SCREEN: the Guard opens the stairwell door and lea inside, checking it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SUSAN:   her eyes are glued to the screen.   Waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE SCREEN: the Guard, finding nothing out of the ordinary, closes the door and continues on down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSAN leans back, exhaling.    Relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the video CRACKLES with a sudden quick burst of stat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Susan GASPS, sitting upright, as she sees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE SCREEN:   the stairwell door OPENS AGAIN.   And th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- something DARK moves out of the stairwell, entering th hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SUSAN: she recoils from the screen in horror, unable t tear her gaze away. Her mouth opens in a silent scream, h eyes widening as she watches --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and then she finds the strength to get to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan bursts out of the security room and runs through th empty lobby, towards the front doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 56a   EXT. OFFICE BUILDING - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan rushes out of the front doors and runs to the stree She frantically hails a cab and gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     35A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 56b   INT. TAXI - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan presses herself in the corner of the back seat, pur clutched tightly in her white knuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shifting wash of colors flood the taxi: the NEON LIGHTS the surrounding buildings tower above, threatening to swa her whole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan rushes through the front doors, clutching her purse strap with both hands. Shaken, just wanting to get home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs to the elevator and jabs the button for her floo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan tries to regain her composure as the elevator rises She closes her eyes and leans against the wall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- not noticing A FAMILIAR PALE JAPANESE BOY looking at h through the window of every floor she passes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toshio. He's standing CLOSER TO THE WINDOW with each floo Until finally, he's RIGHT NEXT TO THE GLASS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator stops at her floor:    no little boy this ti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan gets out of the elevator, moving quickly to her apartment at the end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She chances a look over her shoulder as she puts the key her lock. Then she goes in and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan enters. She takes a long, deep breath. Safe at home She sits at her kitchen table, laying her purse down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes go to the BROKEN CHAIN still hanging from the st with some rabbit's foot fur lodged in the links.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan's home phone RINGS, and she jumps.    She stares at for a moment, then tentatively answers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSAN (INTO PHONE) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW (PHONE) It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04      36A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something strange about his voice:   it's oddly f without inflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04    37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSAN (INTO PHONE) Matthew!   Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTHEW (PHONE) I'm downstairs. What number are you again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSAN (INTO PHONE) 702.   I'll buzz you in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She presses a button on the phone, and is about to hang u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost immediately there's a LOUD KNOCK at her door. She gets to her feet, surprised. How did he get up so fast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan goes to the door and looks through the peephole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HER POV: Matthew's face, distorted by the fish-eye glass. He's looking into the peephole, with a sneer on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're up to, but this is not cool --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She catches her breath.   THERE'S NO ONE THERE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the phone emits the THROATY CROAKING sound.   Quickl growing louder and LOUDER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan cries out and drops the phone. It BREAKS OPEN on th hallway floor as Susan slams her apartment door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan quickly draws the chain lock. Then she builds the courage to step forward, and look through the peephole --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HER POV: the phone lies broken in the middle of the floor Otherwise, the hallway is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan backs away from the door, shaking in fright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathing hard, she backs into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan enters, turning off her cell phone and unplugging t bedroom phone from the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she retreats to the safety of her bed, eyes on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE APARTMENT DOOR, next to the kitchen.    Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan's breathing slows. But she looks around the room, still anxious -- it's too quiet in here. Her panic builds But she's alone in the room, isn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we MOVE IN on Susan, the room starts to become quieter The SOUND OF TRAFFIC from outside, the HUMMING REFRIGERAT in the kitchen... everything fades to a stifling silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Susan notices, all right.    Her breath, now suddenly catches in her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long moment of silence.   Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's coming from the KITCHEN SINK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan stares at it.   She finally stands, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- slowly walks into THE KITCHEN. She reaches out and tur the faucet handle. Tightens it. The dripping stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relieved, Susan turns away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- DRIP.   DRIP.   It begins again.   Louder, more intens

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scared, Susan turns back to the sink. Water is now GUSHIN OUT from the faucet, filling up a bowl in the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slowly reaches out a hand and turns the faucet, as tightly as she can manage --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- tighter... tighter... straining with the effort..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until the water stops.   Only then does she let go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- just then, a CHILD'S PALE HAND quietly rises to the surface from water in the bowl, and starts VIOLENTLY SPLASHING the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04        38A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan screams and runs back to her bedroom --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 62b   INT. SUSAN'S APARTMENT - BEDROOM - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lies down, shivering, pulling the quilt to her chin. final retreat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSAN Please... stop it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SPLASHING SOUNDS in the kitchen continue for a while. Then, it suddenly stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan is so terrified that she almost faints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then her breathing stops.   Her eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her hand reaches up under her pillow, feeling around --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and she comes out with HER LUCKY RABBIT'S FOOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one she left behind in the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan suddenly CRIES OUT, her head tilting back, her body abruptly going stiff. We soon see why:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LUMP begins to rise at the foot of the bed. A big one. Moving slowly up Susan's body. Reaching the edge of the quilt, which slowly rises --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- revealing a QUICK FLASH of the PALE FACE OF THE JAPANE WOMAN WITH LONG DARK HAIR on top of her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan SCREAMS, and is abruptly pulled under the covers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04      39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark and still.   Lying in wait.   Completely silent, exc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- someone's KNOCKING on the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're still KNOCKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently, whoever's KNOCKING isn't going to give up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the DOOR HANDLE jiggles.   But it's locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen's CELL PHONE lays on the table in the foreground. Beyond is the hallway, and the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04       40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The knocking has stopped.    Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Karen's cell phone suddenly LIGHTS UP, ringing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It rings four times, then goes to voice mail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new SOUND breaks the silence: movement outside. Crunchi footsteps on gravel, someone brushing past tree limbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHADOW falls over the window.   A face looks inside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- it's ALEX, Karen's boss. He walks away from the window and continues down the side of the house --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- we TRACK down the hallway, past the bathroom, through kitchen, following his progress into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BACK ROOM: Alex is visible through the sliding door leading to the back porch. He peers inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIS POV: A FIGURE covered head-to-toe in a white sheet li on the mattress. Unmoving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex tries the sliding door -- it's open.     He steps in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX Karen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence greets him.   He stares down at the figure in the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex licks his lips, nervous.   Finally walks to the matt kneeling down next to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raises a hand and grabs the sheet.      Raises it over th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- it's Emma. As we last saw her, eyes on the ceiling, mo and eyes wide open in fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But now it's clear, from the tache noire in the eyes, the blanched skin, the rigidity of her body: she's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex falls back onto his butt, staring at Emma.     He pu himself away from the corpse --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and freezes.    There's something right behind him. He whirls around --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- it's KAREN.    In the corner, looking pale and dazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04       41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
