dialogues.text: Two POLICE CARS and an AMBULANCE are parked out front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An UNMARKED CAR pulls up, and DETECTIVE NAKAGAWA (40s) ex the passenger side. He looks up at The House with dread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver, DETECTIVE IGARASHI (30s), moves next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can handle this myself, you know. It's just a routine call. I don't know why you wanted to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to Nakagawa, awaiting a response. He doesn't get one. Nakagawa just stares up at The House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house feels completely different: all the interior lights are on, a few POLICE OFFICERS mill about, two EMTs wheel EMMA'S BODY out the front door on a gurney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex sits at the kitchen table, frazzled.   He turns to -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- KAREN. She's sitting in the living room, wrapped in a blanket, being attended to by a FEMALE NURSE and speaking with Nakagawa and Igarashi, who is taking notes on a pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen says something and the Detective looks over at Alex Then he speaks to the Nurse, who helps Karen to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa and Igarashi enter the kitchen.    In perfect En

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Detective Nakagawa. This is Detective Igarashi, my assistant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Karen okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04      42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is very shaken. We would like her to stay in the hospital tonight, under evaluation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Alex a wedding picture of MATTHEW AND JENNIFER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know these people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthew Williams, and his wife Jennifer. He's Emma's son, the woman Karen came here to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was the last time you saw him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I met them when they came to register. It's standard procedure, though the visits were arranged by his employer. He works at --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've spoken with his employer.   He did not show up for work today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something about this gives Alex pause. Nakagawa speaks briefly to Igarashi in Japanese, then hands Alex a card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you could please come by tomorrow to make a statement, the address is there, at the bottom --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing) Yoko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen was a substitute -- Yoko is the girl who is normally in charge of Emma. She's also been missing from work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For how long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     42aA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the last two days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa and Igarashi exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I saw her bike outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa heads for the front door as Igarashi continues t interview Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04   42A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa stands outside by the front gate, looking at --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04       43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- YOKO'S BICYCLE.   He looks down at it, frowning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he suddenly cocks his head.    As if sensing somethi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to look up at A WINDOW ON THE SECOND FLOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igarashi stands by the ANSWERING MACHINE.    The message counter reads `1'. He presses PLAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSAN'S MESSAGE replays, and he listens carefully. As it ends, he turns to see NAKAGAWA standing in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Matthew's sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shows Nakagawa a PHOTO of Matthew and Susan, brother a sister, grinning at the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This must be her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The look on Nakagawa's face is grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call her at work, then at home. If no one answers, send someone to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He trails off, looking down at --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the PHONE BASE.   The cordless phone is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa reaches down, pressing the `LOCATE' button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A distant BEEPING SOUND can be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone in the room stops what they're doing.    They li

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa and Igarashi enter from the hallway, followed by their men. They look up to the second floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BEEPING is definitely coming from upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04          44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa and Igarashi come upstairs, their men following close behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pause in the hallway for a moment. Then Nakagawa wal into the rear room (Matthew's office). The BEEPING is clo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands there, in the center of the room, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he looks up, at the ceiling.    Everyone follows sui

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa turns to the CLOSED CLOSET DOORS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He quickly pulls open the door.   The closet is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa looks up, peering into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIS POV:   the ATTIC PANEL yawns wide open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And right next to it are FOUR LONG GROOVES in the ceiling As if something was dragged across it, right to the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like fingernails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa leans out, looking at Igarashi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NAKAGAWA (IN JAPANESE) I need your flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shaft of light from the flashlight through the open att access cuts through the thick darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa appears, pulling himself up into the attic. swings his flashlight slowly around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igarashi comes up next to Nakagawa just as the Detective' flashlight stops on something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat as they exchange an uneasy look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Nakagawa and Igarashi crawl through the darkness tow the far corner of the space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two bodies are tucked into the corner.    MATTHEW AND JEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa sits in front of the bodies, examining them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell... what is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa sees the beeping CORDLESS PHONE a few feet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOMETHING next to it attracts Nakagawa's interest. We can see what it is, but there's some DEEP RED in it, and something very WHITE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Nakagawa's eyes widen as he realizes what he's looking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POLICE CARS outside have attracted a small crowd.   T TWO BODIES are being loaded into a POLICE VAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa stands with THE CORONER. The CORONER'S ASSISTANT wearing a face mask and rubber gloves, approaches. He hol something small, wrapped in a bloody white sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Coroner slowly unfolds the sheet. We can't see what h looking at -- but it elicits quite a reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who does this belong to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Coroner quickly re-covers the object.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can use the blood to help identify the person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Coroner and his assistant walk away:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it possible that someone could live without... that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Coroner turns back, his face pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04   45A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I certainly hope not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa turns away to see Igarashi approaching, talking a cell phone. He looks disturbed. As he hangs up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IGARASHI (IN JAPANESE) Someone just reported another death. It's not in our district... but I think we should check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa realizes something's troubling his partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NAKAGAWA (IN JAPANESE) Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IGARASHI (IN JAPANESE) The cause of death is not clear... but it is the man who sold them this house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the spinning wheels of a bicycle.      A familia

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pedals are being pumped by a beautiful young Japanese woman -- this is YOKO (early 20s).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko turns, riding down a small side street.      It ends she rounds a corner stopping in front of --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 77a   EXT. THE HOUSE - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko opens the gate and walks her bike to the front door, leaning it against the wall nearby (exactly where we saw Matthew bump into it earlier).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rings the door buzzer. Waits. She seems to have expected this: she pulls a KEY from her pocket, with a plastic LABEL on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko steps inside. She instinctively slips off her shoes. She calls out, in decent English:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOKO Hi, excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a small ENVELOPE with YOKO'S NAME resting on a sm table by the door. She takes it, opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04         46A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE LETTER says, simply:   "Out for a walk, back later."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04       47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOKO Emma?   It's Yoko.   I'm coming in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is the least "moved-into" that we've seen so fa although the main furniture is in place, MOVING BOXES are stacked in every room, in various stages of unpacking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's also an unusual amount of mess in the house - disarray, much like the opening sequence, that isn't exac related to moving in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko surveys the room, dismayed by the mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she sees EMMA at the far end of the living room, her back to Yoko. She's looking down at something in her hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOKO Hi, Emma.    It's good to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma turns. Looks blankly at Yoko, who approaches. Realizing the woman doesn't remember her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Yoko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old woman still gives no sign of recognition.   Yoko gently takes her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be in bed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she sees what Emma was looking at: the roll of DUCT TAPE. She's cut her finger on the serrated cutting blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be playing with this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaking her head, Yoko takes the duct tape and looks arou for a place where Emma can't get at it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- she puts the tape ON THE STACK OF BOOKS at the top of bookshelf, next to the scissors (where Matthew found them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04        48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 81a   INT. THE HOUSE - ENTRANCE - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the entrance, we see Yoko come out of the kitchen holding a tray with a teapot and cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks into the BACK ROOM, looking down at Emma's bed. The old woman must be asleep: Yoko gently lays down the tray, quietly steps out of the room and slides the door s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Yoko moves through the LIVING ROOM to the PHONE BASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- she picks up THE CORDLESS, finally where it belongs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko dials a number as she walks into THE ENTRANCE HALL. begins a conversation (in Japanese) as she looks at the scattered rubbish on the ground, shaking her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She climbs up to the SECOND FLOOR, pausing to kneel and p up some pieces of crumpled paper, chatting all the while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUD. THUD. Yoko pauses, turning towards the open door to the front room. The rhythmic THUMPING continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is a mess. The bed is unmade, clothes are strewn the floor. Looks like a storm swept through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko stands in the doorway, listening for the THUMPING sounds. But they've stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finishes her call and hangs up. Sighs. She sticks the cordless phone into her pocket and starts to clean the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Yoko straightens the bedspread, she hears something. Pauses. And we hear it too --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a familiar THROATY CROAKING SOUND.   Quiet and muffled

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04         49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko, a bit unnerved by the strange sound, pulls a small player and headphones from her pocket. She puts them on, goes back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84aa   INT. THE HOUSE - SECOND FLOOR HALLWAY - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko backs into the hallway, humming along to the music. Preoccupied, she doesn't notice as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOOR TO THE REAR ROOM, at the end of the dark hall be her, SLOWLY SWINGS OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko turns and walks down the hall towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84a    INT. THE HOUSE - REAR ROOM - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko enters the room, which is also a mess. The MOVING BO are tumbled about the small room. She sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she notices the CERAMIC CAT on the shelf, FACING HER (where Susan left it).   Apparently she's not a big fan o felines: she uneasily turns it to FACE THE WALL instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko turns back to the room, staring to stack the moving boxes (the way we saw them before). As she does --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- she pauses again. The music in her headphones starts PHASING, digital noise creeping in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko takes off the headphones.   Stares at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then there's another CROAKING SOUND.   From close by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko draws a breath, quickly looking up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- AT THE CEILING, directly above her.   That's where the horrible sound is coming from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freaked out, Yoko backs away, and opens the bedroom door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the hallway is COMPLETELY DARK. An unnatural blackness The skylights above, which were previously filled with sunlight, are now completely opaque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko stands in the doorway, scared, afraid to step into t darkness. Then she looks down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04         49A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HER POV: the murky blackness of the hall seems to be slow CREEPING IN, phantomlike, around the edges of the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko stumbles back into the room.   Her eyes fixed on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- THE DOORWAY: the creeping darkness is now coming in around all sides, not just the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko backs up to the bed, still clutching the CORDLESS PH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back at the door, suddenly CRYING OUT --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04         50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- A BLACK CAT sits in the doorway. Tail wrapped around itself, sitting perfectly still, like a statue. Staring a Yoko with its yellow eyes. Something unnatural about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko backs away towards the closet.   Nowhere to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cat suddenly HISSES AT HER --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and that's all Yoko can take.    In a panic, she opens closet door, ducks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko slams the door shut, pulling herself up onto a raise shelf. Breathing hard, looking down at --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the crack under the door.   The light is beginning to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko presses back into the closet, trapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The closet is starting to get dark.   Quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko looks around desperately.   Looking up, she sees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- THE ATTIC PANEL above her is wide open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caught between a rock and a hard place.   Yoko decides:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakily stands on the shelf and reaches up to pull herself into the attic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko's head appears. Then her shoulders.     She looks ar but can't see a thing in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's about to pull herself all the way up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- when she hears the THROATY CROAKING SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming from the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko stiffens, her breath catching in her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER POV: we're at the far end of the attic, suddenly rapidly RACING FORWARD TOWARDS YOKO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON YOKO:   something brushes her face.   Long, black hair

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a head, just inches from hers.    Almost nose-to-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04      51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko is paralyzed with fear, eyes wide.   A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she reaches into her pocket, pulling out a LIGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko raises it and flicks the wheel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- we get a glimpse of a PALE FACE, surrounded by long bl hair, eyes wide and mouth open, the THROATY SOUND suddenl increasing in pitch and volume --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as the face moves forward --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen slowly wakes up in bed.    As her eyes clear, she s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUG. He sits on the edge of the bed, slightly slumped, h back to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slowly turns -- and a relieved smile crosses his face. moves closer, and reaches out a hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUG It's okay.     I've got you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen nods, lacing her fingers in his. But her eyes are glazed and unfocused -- she's exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUG Your boss told me what happened. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns away, the memory bothering her.    Doug takes h hand, massaging her fingers, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I talked to your teachers. They said you can take as much time as you need. We could go to Kyoto for a weekend, see those temples you're always talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen tries to smile back, but her heart's not in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running away won't help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04   51aA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to run away from, Kat. No one blames you for what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     51A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not even sure what did happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You went to help someone who was, quite simply, beyond help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's not what I mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She trails off, trying to remember.   Doug waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That house. There was something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug sees her frustration, and tenderly brushes a hair fr her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't beat yourself up searching for a greater truth, Kat. An old woman passed away in her sleep. It's sad, but that's all it is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that how they said she died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry this happened to you. But maybe, in a way, it will help you later. Death is an unfortunate but integral part of your future career. There's no avoiding it. Maybe now you'll be more... ready for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I'll ever be ready for something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns away. Doug wraps an arm around her.   Karen lea into him, and he strokes her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moment is broken by a soft KNOCK. Detective Nakagawa stands in the doorway, holding a thick FILE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to disturb you, Miss Davies. I was wondering if you could answer some additional questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug stands, intercepting Nakagawa.   He sticks out a han

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Doug.    Karen's boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa nods. Fixes Doug with a blank stare.   Taking th hint, Doug turns to Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You up for this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding:) Why don't you find out when I can check out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reluctantly, Doug kisses her brow, then exits. Nakagawa pulls a chair up to the bed and sits, putting the file on small table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   Tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are an exchange student? (Karen nods:) And you have been volunteering at the Health Center for...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three months. I needed a social welfare credit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said this was the first time you'd been in that house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She notices Nakagawa isn't taking notes. He seems somewha uncomfortable, as if he's building to something:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About the Japanese boy you said you saw there --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you find him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not yet. You said the boy had been taped into the closet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that's right. He was... holding a cat. A black cat. (remembering:) There was a book in the closet, too. I think it was a journal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did it belong to the boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04   53aA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. I think it belonged to a woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04   53A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa looks up.   Karen tries to explain:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The writing. It looked feminine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04    54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left it on the kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa frowns, scribbles a note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't see any book on the table. Perhaps someone moved it. Did you speak with the boy after you opened the closet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks, recalling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked him his name.   He said `Toshio'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa immediately tenses. A long beat. He can see how exhausted Karen is. But something's troubling him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more question, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slowly reaches into his pocket and pulls out THE PHOTO Karen found, and taped together. He shows it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found this in the room where...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen looks at the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is him. This is the boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you certain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   Positive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa stares down at the picture in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Karen notices -- Nakagawa's hands are shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Nakagawa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up at her, a faraway look in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole time I was in that house, I felt something was... wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     54A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the expression on Nakagawa's face, she's onto someth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa holds Karen's gaze for a moment. Even in her exhausted state, it's clear -- she's as frightened as he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04      55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bodies of the son and daughter- in-law of the woman you were caring for were found in the attic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen just stares at him, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems that the son killed his wife, and then himself --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a KNOCK on the door. Igarashi stands in the doorw He speaks to Nakagawa in Japanese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Karen) Please excuse me for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa puts the photo down and steps into the hallway a closes the door, but not all the way. Karen watches and listens through the crack:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE HALLWAY:   the men speak with hushed voices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We checked the apartment of Susan, the sister. She wasn't there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He trails off, hesitating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NAKAGAWA (IN JAPANESE) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chain lock had been drawn from the inside. And the deadbolt. But we found no one in the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the surveillance tapes from the office building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igarashi nods.    But doesn't move.   After a moment, qui

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were the first family to live in that house since the incident three years ago --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04        56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa's harsh look silences him. Then the Detective turns, noticing KAREN watching them. He pulls the door sh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa's stern voice is muffled by the closed door. sits back in bed, disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then her attention turns to THE FILE on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She considers.   Then reaches for it.   Opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a POLICE REPORT, in Japanese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen scans it, and turns the page.     She draws a breat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- it's a photo of THE HOUSE. Cordoned off with police ta An ambulance out front. Like the scene she just left...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...only the picture is dated three years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE DETECTIVES are visible beyond the open front door, conferring in the entryway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The photo of the house is attached to a POLICE REPORT, wi THREE PICTURES. A stern-looking Japanese man (TAKEO), a somber woman (KAYAKO), and a YOUNG BOY we know very well

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen makes the connection. She picks up the taped-up pho and compares it to the file... the boy and his father are same as in the newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen gently touches the "missing" face of KAYAKO -- then eyes move to the picture of THE BOY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes widen as she reads THE JAPANESE TEXT under his f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN Toshio...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is quiet, completely deserted.    Except for --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Alex. He's behind his desk in the reception area, star off into space. Alex finally glances up at a clock -- it' almost ten o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up, turns off his computer, switches off the ligh and walks around the reception desk towards --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FRONT DOORS. He hits a final light switch and is almo to the exit, when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- he suddenly SLIPS. Almost falls.    Saves himself by throwing a hand up against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down.    What the hell did he slip on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pool of liquid. Right by the front doors, where the lad stood earlier. It's too dark to make out what the fluid i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex looks down at HIS HAND -- it's covered in the liquid And there's a dark HANDPRINT where he grabbed the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIS POV: a trail of FOOTPRINTS lead from the pool of liqu around the base of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes on his dirtied hand, Alex slowly reaches for the nearby light switch. The overheads come on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the liquid is deep red.   Blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex looks across the room. Shaking, he starts to walk forward, following the footsteps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses at the bottom of the stairs, seeing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the BLOOD TRAIL has stopped.   Right by the bottom ste

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex looks up the staircase.   No blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, Alex starts to walk up.    As he reaches first landing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He freezes.   Sensing something behind him.   He turns to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOKO. Head lowered, clothing is torn and bloody. She's slowly climbing up the steps, but she's MOVING JERKILY, l a marionette, her limbs making a strange CREAKING as if tendons and muscles are being pushed to their limits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's BLOOD DRIPPING DOWN, splattering on her shoes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She keeps moving, straining, climbing... towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04       58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX What... What happened, Yoko?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now she finally stops, two steps away.    A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX Say something, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoko slowly raises her head towards him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the lower half of her face is missing. Her jawbone has been ripped out, her tongue hanging limply on her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex stumbles backwards... and his foot lands right in a puddle of blood. His legs fly out from under him and he CRACKS HIS HEAD AGAINST THE GROUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIS POV: everything goes blurry, and canted 90 degrees. it looks like there's A FIGURE standing in the hallway, watching the scene...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a small boy holding a black cat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dazed, Alex plants a hand on the ground and pulls himself into a seating position --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and coming face-to-face with YOKO, kneeling down direc in front of him. Her bloody tongue dripping, lolling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON ALEX:   eyes wide, he opens his mouth to scream --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa sits at the desk. Exhausted, dark circles under eyes, he's staring down at --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FILE on his desk.   As if he's afraid to even open it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he does. He flips through the photos, pausing on that TOSHIO, but continuing on to THE BLACK AND WHITE PHOTO of House from three years ago (the one Karen saw), with the THREE DETECTIVES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa turns to a FRAMED PICTURE on his desk -- it's YOUNGER NAKAGAWA at a bar with THREE FAMILIAR DETECTIVES. They're off-duty, grinning at the camera. Buddies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two photographs share THE SAME THREE DETECTIVES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04      59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nakagawa looks at the crime scene photo, he realizes something. He slowly stands, in shock, trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone RINGS, startling him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa walks over, picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NAKAGAWA (IN JAPANESE) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face goes blank.    He slowly lowers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CORONER sits on a stool, staring at the floor. TWO BODIES lie under bloody white sheets on two STEEL TABLES. Between them is a small cart -- a bloody cloth on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa and Igarashi enter. The Coroner stands, nervous. He walks to one of the tables and pulls back the sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you determined a cause of death?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. The blood on his body -- isn't his. It belongs to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to the other table.    But doesn't look at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. He killed Yoko, before he died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Coroner shakes his head. Nakagawa looks to Igarashi, then walks up to the second body, pulling back the sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IT'S YOKO.    Still missing her jawbone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa and Igarashi stare down at her in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Coroner walks to the small table, removing the cloth. Yoko's JAWBONE is underneath it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jawbone you found in the attic yesterday with the American couple belongs to this girl. I estimate it was -- removed -- from her body two or three days ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I thought you said her body was found with this man, tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Coroner nods.    Eyes on his shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how did she get from the house to the Health Center?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Coroner, lost in his imagination, answers quietly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.   Nakagawa walks to the jawbone.   Stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She survived for two days without this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would seem so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is that possible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Coroner looks up at him, his face pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug sits on the bed, next to a DRESSING CURTAIN. Karen's silhouette is visible behind it, pulling on her clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches the curtain for a beat, concerned.     Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUG I got us a guidebook to Kyoto. I thought maybe we'd leave tomorrow --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The curtain suddenly SLIDES BACK.    Karen, dressed, star him. She looks angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUG Tell you what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN About the bodies they found in the attic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUG You were recovering from a shock. I didn't want to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen turns away, picking up her backpack and slinging it She walks past him, disappointed, and leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUG Karen -- wait --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He quickly grabs his coat and bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen paces down the hall towards a RECEPTION AREA. catches up with her, turning her towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUG Look, I'm sorry. I was just worried about you, and -- I know you, Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen turns to him.   A sober look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04   61A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same thing happened three years ago, Doug. To a Japanese family, who lived in that house. They were all found dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug studies her for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you think the events are connected?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you explain it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches Doug as he thinks.   Carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. How about this: the American family knew about what had happened there before, and this knowledge subconsciously caused them to repeat the same events.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen gives Doug a skeptical look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's exactly how superstitions survive: if you walk under a ladder and think uh-oh, you're in for some bad luck, sure enough, what do you know? You trip over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heard it before:) -- trip over the curb and sprain your ankle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes sense, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen stops walking.   Considering something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04   61B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Then explain this: when I went to that house, I didn't know anything about its past. But yet I still saw...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hesitates, realizing she's said too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saw what?    Karen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma and I were alone in that room, but -- there was something else there. I'm sure of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You watched a woman die, Kat. That's a horrible thing to experience. I can't imagine how you must feel. But sometimes the mind tries to cope with terrible things in a way that distorts what actually occurred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen's eyes never leave his.   Softly, but firmly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might be right, Doug. But I know what I saw. (then, faltering:) I think I know what I saw...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, Doug pulls her into a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just need to rest. We'll get you home, get a good night's sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But her eyes speak differently. She covers it well, stepp back and glancing over at the reception desk:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got class, and I'm sure I only have to fill out a few forms or something --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04        61BA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine, Doug. Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her, then exits. He pauses at the front doors t give her a little wave. She smiles... but the smile droop as soon as he's out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, she turns and walks to the front desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04      61C-63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen sits at her computer desk.   She looks exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Online, Karen pulls up the home page for The Japan Times, English-language newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She types Toshio's full name into a SEARCH window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LIST of links appear, filling the screen. Karen scans them. Tries one. It's not what she's looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She re-enters Toshio's name along with a year -- `2001'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only ONE LINK appears.   The word `MURDERED' in the headl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04      64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen clicks it.   The article fills the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Karen reads it, we catch glimpses of names -- `Toshio' `Kayako', `Takeo'. And an ominous phrase: "MURDER/SUICIDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen clicks a link marked `IMAGE'. A scanned picture of newspaper appears -- the article is on the front page, wi familiar photos of Toshio, Kayako and Takeo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then Karen's eyes drift to another picture at the bot of the page --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- PETER. She quickly recognizes him from the picture she found in the journal. His name is printed below the photo A picture of Peter and Maria's CONDO BUILDING is next to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at the headline:   "AMERICAN ENGLISH TEACHER TH SELF FROM BUILDING".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen scans the article, thinking.   Then she looks up at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa is looking at the same picture, in his file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER #1 appears in the hall.   Knocks gently on the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER #1 (IN JAPANESE) This just came in. It's the surveillance video you requested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes a moment for Nakagawa to snap out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finally nods, takes the tape. He opens the envelope an looks at the cassette. Like he doesn't want to watch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he turns to a TV/VCR combo and inserts the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE SCREEN: the 10TH FLOOR HALLWAY from Susan's office building, and the door leading to the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.   The image FLICKERS for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the door suddenly bursts open and Susan, terrified, from the stairwell and down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON NAKAGAWA:   he fast-forwards the video.   Until --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04       65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN: -- the SECURITY GUARD appears in the hallway. Susan saw earlier, he opens the door to the stairwell and looks inside. Then he closes the door and continues o.s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON NAKAGAWA:   he reaches forward to turn off the video -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN:   -- but then the video CRACKLES with a quick of static.   And the door to the stairwell opens again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON NAKAGAWA: he's watching, entranced, terrified.      He hardly believe what he's seeing --

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: the shape of a woman with long hair --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but the figure is BLURRY AND SHIFTING, as if the black shadow has loosely compacted itself into the form of a hu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NAKAGAWA watches, breathless, as THE FIGURE slowly enters hallway, passing by, underneath the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The image stops flickering.    An empty hallway now.   A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa, his hand shaking, reaches forward, about to tur off the television set, when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARKNESS SUDDENLY OVERTAKES THE SCREEN, rising up from th bottom until everything is dark. A strange HUMMING RATTLE comes from the speakers, and the image JITTERS madly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa leans forward, right up to the screen, trying to make out an image in the swirling blackness --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two eyes open, staring at Nakagawa. Terrified, Nakagawa stands and turns away, closing his ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when he finds the strength to look back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- THE EYES are still there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Locked onto him, even though he's moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unflinching.   Unblinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa stands at the front door.    Gathering his coura

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the door.   Nothing but yawning darkness inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa picks up TWO HEAVY OBJECTS, one in each hand, an ducking under the police tape, enters the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa puts the two heavy objects by the front door and closes it. Now we can see what they are --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- GASOLINE CANS.    Two gallons each.   Full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa catches his breath. Then he reaches for the lid one of the cans, starting to unscrew it. His hands are shaking, and the gasoline SPLASHES AROUND inside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but then there's ANOTHER SPLASHING SOUND.     From nea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa freezes.    The splashing continues.    His eyes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BATHROOM DOOR. It's closed. The SPLASHING is coming from inside, accompanied by a series of THUDS. The sounds a small child, STRUGGLING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa fearfully reaches for the door handle --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa's eyes widen as the door swings open.     He see

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG BOY kneeling by the edge of the tub, overflowing water. His head hangs below the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa immediately drops to the boy, lifting his lifele head from the water. It's TOSHIO. He's dead. Drowned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Nakagawa can understand what's happening, the boy' eyes SUDDENLY OPEN, fixing on Nakagawa --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and then a PALE HAND grabs Nakagawa's head from behind roughly pushes it into the water, holding him under.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakagawa's LEGS flail and kick as he struggles, his SCREA muffled by the water. But finally, his legs become still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04   67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 109a   OMITTED                                 109a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04      68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WALL by Karen's computer desk is now covered with WEB PRINT-OUTS: NEWSPAPER CLIPPINGS of TOSHIO and his parents KAYAKO and TAKEO; MATTHEW and JENNIFER; PETER; and DETECTIVES NAKAGAWA and IGARASHI, plus reports on THE EAR INVESTIGATION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the center of it all is a picture of The House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE DESK is a PRINT-OUT: the newspaper article about Peter's death, with the photo of his CONDO. Below the pho Karen has written the number `224'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the sound of RUNNING WATER -- it's the shower. drift away from the desk and towards the bathroom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 110a   OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04        68A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 110b   OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen is in the shower. She stands there, glassy-eyed, as the water runs over her. She's looking at --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- HER REFLECTION in the mirror. It fogs up, obscuring th view. This snaps Karen out of her trance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rinses her hair and squeezes some shampoo into her ha Starts a nice lather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM BEHIND: Karen works the shampoo into her scalp.   Bu as she does, we see something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... A PALE HAND BURIED UNDER HER HAIR, as if someone is behind her, with a hand on her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen's fingers brush the hand.   She CRIES OUT and turns

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- there's no one there.   She's alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's the sound of the front door UNLOCKING and Doug enters, carrying a bag. He closes the door behind him and walks in, turning the corner --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- finding Karen, looking a bit dazed, standing right the He's startled, but quickly recovers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUG I come bearing gifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen smiles weakly. She takes the bag and enters the kitchen. He watches her go, worried. Then he notices --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HER DESK. Doug walks over, looking at the printouts she's taped to the wall. And the photo of The House in the cent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bewildered, he sits down, leaning forward and taking a go look. His eyes stop on the picture of TOSHIO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug turns to see Karen staring at him from the kitchen. It's an awkward moment: he's concerned, but doesn't know what to say. And neither does Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally she approaches, looking at Toshio's picture:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04      69A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the boy who was there yesterday. In that house. But this boy, he's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her voice trembles, her fear showing through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- he's supposed to be dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.   Karen's eyes plead with Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw him, Doug. I talked to him. He told me his name. A boy who was killed by his father three years ago told me his name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug looks away, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I believe you, Karen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen's face darkens.   Before she can retort --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the phone RINGS. As Karen walks across the room to ans it, Doug starts reading the newspaper article.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She listens.   Her face slowly drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost a whisper:) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She numbly lowers the phone.   Doug turns to her, seeing something's very wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snapping to life, Karen walks to the desk, picking up the photo of Peter and Maria's condo and a map of Tokyo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug puts a hand on her shoulder.    She finally looks at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Yoko are dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug, surprised, doesn't know what to say.   Karen doesn' give him a chance to figure it out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04        69AA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intense:) There's something wrong with that house, Doug. Something really bad. (re: Peter's photo) The boy in that house, he had a photo of this man. He died on that same day three years ago. I need to talk to his wife... widow. If I can find out what happened, or if... maybe --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen pulls away, making for the door.   Doug follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm concerned about you going out while you're so upset --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand.   I have to, Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I've been inside that house, Doug. Don't you get it? I've been inside!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     69B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. We see the resolve come over Karen's face.   She reaches out and touches Doug tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. But I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug, troubled, turns back to the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up at the wall, tracing a finger over the photo The House. Beneath it, is the address...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     70-72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same building from the newspaper clipping.   Monolith against a cloudy, bleak sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen stands before it, staring up at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she walks to the intercom and looks at the directory finds `M. Kirk'. She activates the intercom and dials the number. It rings a few times, and then a voice picks up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIA (INTERCOM, IN JAPANESE) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN I'm looking for Maria Kirk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIA (INTERCOM) Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN My name is Karen Davies. I'm a student at -- I'm sorry to bother you, but I was wondering if I could ask you a few questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat.   Karen stares at the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN Ms. Kirk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIA (INTERCOM) Questions about what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN I'm here because... I need to speak with you about your husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Maria's voice comes back through the intercom, she sounds different, shaken:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIA (INTERCOM) Leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN Maria --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIA (INTERCOM) Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen stands there for a moment.   Then, as she walks awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04        72A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK.   The electronic door lock disengages behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04   73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 115a   OMITTED                                 115a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 115b   OMITTED                                 115b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 116a   INT. PETER & MARIA'S APARTMENT - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door opens. MARIA (early 30s) has changed from when we first saw her -- she wears a revealing outfit, an her natural beauty now smolders beneath the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She regards Karen warily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIA I'm late for work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN I just need a couple minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria finally steps aside, letting Karen in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The APARTMENT is small, and completely unkempt.    The ki is a mess, clothes lie everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIA (sarcastic:) Make yourself at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen looks for a place to sit.    She decides to stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria sizes her up.   A beat.   Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIA Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN Your husband, Peter.    Three years ago he...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She trails off, in delicate territory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIA He what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN He killed himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria eyes her blankly. Then she turns to look at somethi o.s. Karen follows her gaze --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- to the open door of THE BEDROOM.     And THE WINDOW be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04        74A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost ashamed:) I'm... sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria turns back to her, sadness on her face.   Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria reaches for a pack of cigarettes.   Lights one.   O them to Karen. She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know Peter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think there's a connection between your husband's death and something that happened to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's... hard to explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria takes a drag from her cigarette.    Waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know this sounds strange, but... I don't think your husband wanted to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (even:) Then why would he throw himself out a window?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen struggles to find the answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me guess: `hard to explain'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen nods.   Maria's brave face slips.   She turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04    74B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put all this behind me. I don't want to open it back up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's true, then why are you still here in Japan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria turns back.   She only looks defensive for a moment

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I can't leave. I tried. But I couldn't. Not without...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria speaks softly, forming words she's never spoken alo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He usually didn't wake up before me. But that morning, he did. He made coffee for us. Then he sat there and waited for me to wake up. And when I did, he looked me right in the eye. And then he jumped. The night before we'd been talking about having children together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wipes away the tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know a woman named Kayako?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Peter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria turns away, growing tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it was someone he worked with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. I've had the police up here, I talked with Detectives, I even hired a P.I.-- (composing herself:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     74C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIA (cont'd) I don't know what you're going through, or what you think you know about my husband. But I don't have any answers. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns back to Karen -- to find the young woman sittin slumped on the edge of a sofa, tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria softens as Karen looks up at her, pleading:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. I don't know what else to do. Please help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04     75-77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria reaches up to a high shelf. She moves a few things aside to get to TWO SHOEBOXES buried towards the rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 118a   INT. PETER & MARIA'S APARTMENT - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria re-enters the room, laying the shoeboxes on a table

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIA This is all his stuff from school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at the boxes, afraid to open them. Karen sits down and gently removes the lid of one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOX contains stacks of PHOTOGRAPHS and notes. Karen removes a pile of photos and starts looking through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, Maria sits down next to her. She opens th other box and pulls out another stack of photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at the first one, sadness crossing her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIA This was our first date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shows Karen THE TOP PHOTO: a "self-portrait" of Peter and Maria in a park lined with blooming cherry trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pain returns, and she puts the picture away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen works through her own pile: she's looking at pictur of Peter from his University days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes widen as she sees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayako. She looks young and alive... but yet somehow sull and withdrawn, as if she feels she doesn't belong there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's with a group of fellow students. PETER is in the group, although he and Kayako aren't next to one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen turns to the next picture -- it's a graduation part

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayako is in this one too: standing to the side, watching PETER AND MARIA as they give a goofy grin to the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04      77A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Karen flips through them, a definite pattern emerges -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Kayako is in practically every picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in most, she's not smiling at the camera.    Rather, staring at Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath:) Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   Did you find something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move to THE GROUP PHOTO. Peter with Maria, surrounded classmates. Kayako off to the side, her eyes on Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04        78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same GROUP PHOTO is in a frame on Peter's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter stands behind the desk, using a small mirror to kno his tie. His open door reads: `DEPARTMENT OF ENGLISH'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CO-WORKER (20s, Japanese) enters with a stack of mail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER Happy Monday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CO-WORKER Yeah, right. Here's your mail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands it to Peter. On the top is a small BLUE ENVELOPE The name in the return address is `Kayako'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CO-WORKER Another one, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter shakes his head, looking distastefully at the lette

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER I don't even know her. She says I used to tutor her, but I don't know who the hell she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The co-worker shrugs and leaves.    Disturbed, Peter fing the blue envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes go to one of his desk drawers.    He slides it o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More BLUE ENVELOPES are inside.    All from `KAYAKO'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's face darkens.   He dumps the letters into a trash

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter stands in front of The House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances down at the BLUE ENVELOPE in his hand. He stuf it in his pocket, unsure about what he's going to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he opens the gate and goes in, walking to the front door. Knocks. Silence from inside. He rings the bell. Waits. No one comes. He's about to leave --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then he hears something from around the side of the house. It sounded like a muffled SPLASH of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 120a   EXT. THE HOUSE - SIDE - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter peers around the side of the house, a narrow walkwa lined with bushes and trees. It's quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER (IN JAPANESE) Hello?   Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, Peter decides to check it out. As he step around a bush, he suddenly stops, surprised to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER'S POV: two ARMS hang from a window at the side of t house. They look disembodied, mottled and bruised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04      79A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes Peter a moment to recover.   He slowly walks ove

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04      80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A familiar BOY is inside -- it's TOSHIO. His glazed and staring eyes don't seem to notice Peter, standing right i front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER (IN JAPANESE) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reaction. There's definitely something wrong with this boy. Peter looks beyond him, into the dark house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER (IN JAPANESE) My name is Peter. I'm here to see your mother. Is she home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy slowly straightens. His eyes focus on Peter. Then he FALLS BACKWARDS. Startled, Peter tries to see inside:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER (IN JAPANESE) Hey!   Are you okay??? Hello???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter quickly goes back to the front door.   Tries the ha - it's unlocked. He opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter steps inside, unsure about entering uninvited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER (IN JAPANESE) (calling out) Hello? Excuse me. I'm coming in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His concern for the boy wins out. He kicks off his shoes, and quickly walks to the open bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter enters, finding Toshio lying on the floor. He must have been standing on the edge of a TUB by the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER (IN JAPANESE) Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Peter helps the boy to his feet, he glances at the bathtub. It's filled, literally to the brim, with water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter holds Toshio's hand as he leads him back to a couch the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER (IN JAPANESE) Are you alone? Where are your parents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy sits in the couch, slumped over, still looking da

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter studies him, looking at the ugly BRUISES on his arm and legs. There's also a big one around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER (IN JAPANESE) What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter reaches out to lift Toshio's chin, but he FLINCHES, pulling backwards. His eyes manage to focus on Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the boy looks away.    Lowers his head.   A long bea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's worried. This really doesn't look good.     He sc the messy room, eyes falling on something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches down and picks up PIECES OF A PHOTOGRAPH, lyin next to a broken frame -- they've been crumpled into a ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE PHOTO: Peter unfolds the pieces and rearranges the We've seen this picture before --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a FAMILY PORTRAIT. TOSHIO, holding a cute BLACK CAT. Standing with his mother and father -- KAYAKO and TAKEO. They're all beaming at the camera, a perfect, happy famil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except that the mother's face has been torn out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then there's a muffled MEOW.    Peter looks over at the w Did that come from outside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another MEOW.   Peter walks to the window, looking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM OUTSIDE, LOOKING IN: a worried look crosses Peter's face as the MEOW becomes more of a GROWL, as if in warnin He looks outside, but can't see anything --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04        82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but we see, over Peter's shoulder, that TOSHIO is now LOOKING DIRECTLY AT HIM, eyes wide --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the MEOWING emitting from his wide open mouth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen enters quickly, going up to the front desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER #2, filling out paperwork, doesn't look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN (IN JAPANESE) Excuse me, I need to speak with Detective Nakagawa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer #2 looks up at her.   Blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN (IN JAPANESE) It's an emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER #2 (IN JAPANESE) One moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer #2 walks to the end of the desk, where two more OFFICERS speak in hushed tones with DETECTIVE AOKI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer #2 interrupts their conversation. And they all lo over at Karen. A beat. Then Detective Aoki approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AOKI (IN ENGLISH) You are asking for Detective Nakagawa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN Yes, I have important information for him about a case...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around. Everyone is watching her. The mood is decidedly grim. She can tell something's up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AOKI Detective Nakagawa is not here right now. Can you tell me what case this is regarding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something behind the Detective's words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN His partner, Detective Igarashi? Can I speak with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aoki exchanges a look with the officers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AOKI Can you tell me your name, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen looks at the somber faces in the quiet station. backs away from the desk as the realization sinks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN They're dead, aren't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen turns and runs for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AOKI Miss, wait please --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's long gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A reading light on the computer desk provides the only illumination in the dark apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen enters, standing in the doorway for a moment.     S shocked. As she slides off her coat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN Doug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04    83A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. She slowly walks to the bedroom and looks insi He's not there. This seems to worsen Karen's mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revisions (Blue) -- 1/26/04       84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen looks down at a NOTEPAD. She's written THREE JAPANE NAMES. The detectives in charge of the case three years a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all have red lines drawn through them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we PAN UP to see that these are the last names on a longer list. We recognize the other names: MATTHEW, JENNIFER, and EMMA WILLIAMS; YOKO and ALEX; NAKAGAWA and IGARASHI. Everyone who's been in The House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone who died.   All the names have been CROSSED OUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- except `Nakagawa' and `Igarashi'.    Karen picks up a pen and draws a line through them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we see one final name at the bottom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
